pull.title: [Qt] Payment request expiration bug fix
pull.body:
Currently a payment request is only checked for expiration upon receipt.
It should be checked again immediately before sending coins to prevent
the user from paying to an expired invoice which would then require a
customer service interaction.

events.body:
Automatic sanity-testing: PASSED, see http://jenkins.bluematt.me/pull-tester/p4122_5f5c4b5f92ddfc528b97901da1fdff0334a8ed27/ for binaries and test log.
This test script verifies pulls every time they are updated. It, however, dies sometimes and fails to test properly.  If you are waiting on a test, please check timestamps to verify that the test.log is moving at http://jenkins.bluematt.me/pull-tester/current/
Contact BlueMatt on freenode if something looks broken.
The check looks sane; but ideally this validation logic should be in the wallet model, not the click event handler.
@aalness, can you move the check to `model->sendCoins`?
This needs some love :), as it's rather important IMHO.

Looks like the original submitter went AWOL.
@diapolo Care to rebase this and address the remark?

issue.title: [Qt] Payment request expiration bug fix (re-done)
issue.body:
- this is based on #4122 (which can be closed)

Currently a payment request is only checked for expiration upon receipt.
It should be checked again immediately before sending coins to prevent
the user from paying to an expired invoice which would then require a
customer service interaction.
- add static verifyExpired() function to PaymentServer to be able to use
  the same validation code in GUI and unit-testing code
- extend unit tests to use that function and also add an unit test which
  overflows, because payment requests allow expires as uint64, whereas we
  use int64_t for verification of expired payment requests

issue.title: [BIP 70] submit payment ignores expire time
issue.body:
When an user loads up a Bitcoin Payment Request and the current time has past the expire time of the BPR you get the message: 'Payment request expired'. Right.
But when an user loads the BPR in time and wants to submit the payment when the time of the BPR has expired the user is not prevented from sending.

The user should be prevented or at least get a warning he is about to send funds to an address of a expired BPR.
